title: MD & CH
text:
Welcome to MD & CH


A Convenient Way for you







We are a group of theoreticians with diverse backgrounds in chemistry, physics, electrical engineering, materials science, and applied mathematics working at the interface of electron microscopy with nanophotonics, quantum materials, and quantum optics. Our research provides insight and understanding in the discovery of quantum, optical, magnetic, and thermal materials phenomena spanning the frontiers of high space, momentum, polarization, and energy resolution. Deep connection to experiment influences everything we do.

title: Blog

Machine learning-based investigation of secretome in cancer cells





Deregulation of the protein secretory pathway (PSP) is linked to many hallmarks of cancer, such as promoting tissue invasion and modulating cell-cell signaling.

title: About
text:
I’m driven by helping others successfully solve problems like turning complex data into clear, actionable insights that help businesses thrive. My toolkit to deliver these solutions draws on blending business understanding with machine learning using SQL, R, SAS, and Python . I’m passionate about using data to solve real-world problems, streamline processes, and find new growth opportunities. Balancing the technical side with a strong understanding of business needs, I create solutions that make a real impact and keep things moving forward.
Feel free to reach out to me on LinkedIn or drop me an email to discuss. 






Experiences

Independent Contractor
Present I guide commercial decisions and provide insights for new product based on a segmentation, forecast, and sensitivity analysis. The analysis modeled potential patients, health care professionals, prior sales, and sensitivity to interactions. I developed the workflow for this analysis to be flexible to handle new drugs and markets using Python and SQL in the Dataiku DSS platform.
Business Analytics Consultant, MCD Key Concepts , August 2015 – Dec 2023
My work involved in applying machine learning algorithms on data from market location, client features, and service demands. Leveraged data analytics to prioritize leads. I also built a forecasting platform using R that cut error 30-50% relative to the sales forecasts in our core business. This platform could handle forecasts for different measures (revenue, units) and different time periods (weeks, months, quarters ahead). This improved sales performance by an additional 10%. The results were communicated with teams through serverless dashboard and Shiny.
Senior Scientist, Biotherapeutics and Proteomics,Protea, Feb 2014 - Mar 2015
I guided experiment designs for biomarker discoveries, streamlined workflows and cut processing time 20-30%. Led a team to win multi-contracts with major pharmaceutical companies. The workflows successfully implemented cutting edge techniques, improved low abundance peptide detection limits ~10X, resulting in customer satisfaction.
Postdoctoral fellow, The University of Texas at Austin, Proteomics core facility, Sep 2011-Jan 2014
I applied bio-analytical strategies, data visualization, and statistical methods to support proteomics core facility. Developed a workflow using statistical/ machine learning methods to predict elution time to target low abundance signals, resulting in accepted publications and grant awards.
Postdoctoral fellow, Nevada Cancer Institute, Cancer Proteomics, Jan 2009- Aug 2011
My work focused on detecting protein interactions and biomarker discoveries for both metabolome and proteome in cancer cells. I applied R to for data clean-up, organization, visualization ,and statistical analysis (such as SVF, Xgboost).
Ph.D. in Cancer Studies (2009) University of Manchester, Manchester, UK

title: Machine learning-based investigation of secretome in cancer cells
text:
For cancer proteomics studies Chris Lee and interactive app [Shiny] ( https://clee23.shinyapps.io/World_Covid_trend/) giving an overview of machine learning approaches for annotation of small compounds in mass spectrometry data.
